To
 
hold
 
you
 
in
 
perpetual
 
amity
,


To
 
make
 
you
 
brothers
,
 
and
 
to
 
knit
 
your
 
hearts


With
 
an
 
unslipping
 
knot
,
 
take
 
Antony


Octavia
 
to
 
his
 
wife
,
 
whose
 
beauty
 
claims


No
 
worse
 
a
 
husband
 
than
 
the
 
best
 
of
 
men
;


Whose
 
virtue
 
and
 
whose
 
general
 
graces
 
speak


That
 
which
 
none
 
else
 
can
 
utter
.
 
By
 
this
 
marriage


All
 
little
 
jealousies
,
 
which
 
now
 
seem
 
great
,


And
 
all
 
great
 
fears
,
 
which
 
now
 
import
 
their
 
dangers
,


Would
 
then
 
be
 
nothing
.
 
Truths
 
would
 
be
 
tales
,


Where
 
now
 
half-tales
 
be
 
truths
.
 
Her
 
love
 
to
 
both


Would
 
each
 
to
 
other
 
and
 
all
 
loves
 
to
 
both


Draw
 
after
 
her
.
 
Pardon
 
what
 
I
 
have
 
spoke
,


For
 
’tis
 
a
 
studied
,
 
not
 
a
 
present
 
thought
,


By
 
duty
 
ruminated
.
